TopicTitle: Bill is in a Minmar orbit, Jeb is being ejected from the solar system, thx MÃ¼n..

Articles.Content:
This update has caused more grief to widows than ever before. A simple explosion, and we could all move on with our lives. A tragedy sure, but progress must be maintained.

Now, it\'s not so easy anymore.

Bob was the first victim after a failed MÃ¼n approach.

Bill is in an orbit following Minmus. Jeb was in an eccentric Kerbal orbit until the bloody MÃ¼n put him on an ejection trajectory towards deep space.

With an infinite koxygen supply in their suits, what will the people back on Kerbin think, if we merely leave them there!?

Why, oh why cruel world. We have to arrange rescue missions, the cost, why won\'t someone think of the cost??

Woe is me.
Oh, Jeb. Off to cause havoc to another star in several light years.
Time for a government cover up. ;D But seriously, Jeb is probably having the time of his life.

Jeb was in an eccentric Kerbal orbit until the bloody MÃ¼n put him on an ejection trajectory towards deep space. With an infinite koxygen supply in their suits, what will the people back on Kerbin think, if we merely leave them there!?

They will think of brave Jeb, making a large step for Kerbalkind by bringing them to the stars. Eventually.

Of course, we\'ll have to update the Wikipedia page for Panspermia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panspermia

It\'ll need to go something like 'Panspermia (Greek: ?????????? from ???/??? (pas/pan) 'all' and ?????? (sperma) 'seed') is the hypothesis that life exists throughout the Universe, distributed by meteoroids, asteroids and planetoids, and lost Kerbals.'
